alert.note: Alert for Chase; Hayes; Lincoln; Perkins (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 5:00PM CDT until May 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT/10 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Nebraska and west central Nebraska, including the following counties, in southwest Nebraska, Chase, Hayes, Keith, Lincoln and Perkins. In west central Nebraska, Arthur. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT /1000 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 PM MDT /500 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over portions of the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ogallala, Grant, Paxton, Wallace, Brule, Madrid, Elsie, Wellfleet, Lamar, Sarben, Roscoe, Sutherland Reservoir State Recreation Area, Keystone, Kingsley Dam, Dickens, Lemoyne, Chase, Grainton, Nevens and Broganville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
